intro: Baccharis fevillei, commonly known as the Florida baccharis, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. It has a woody stem and produces small, oval-shaped fruits that are dispersed by wind. Baccharis fevillei plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
